unnormalised: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued a notification regarding mandatory linking of Permanent Account Number (PAN) with Know Your Customer (KYC) details for all bank accounts by 31/12/2024. Failure to comply may result in the freezing of accounts, impacting transactions and access to banking services. Customers are advised to contact their respective banks and submit the necessary documentation, including a copy of their PAN card and Aadhaar card, before the stipulated deadline.
normalised: The Reserve Bank of India (R-B-I) has issued a notification regarding mandatory linking of Permanent Account Number (P-A-N) with Know Your Customer (K-Y-C) details for all bank accounts by thirty first December two thousand and twenty four. Failure to comply may result in the freezing of accounts, impacting transactions and access to banking services. Customers are advised to contact their respective banks and submit the necessary documentation, including a copy of their P-A-N card and Aadhaar card, before the stipulated deadline.

unnormalised: The move aims to enhance transparency and combat financial fraud by streamlining the identification process. Banks are also obligated to update their records with the latest Customer Identification File (CIF) number and ensure accurate information is reflected in the system. RBI circular no. RBI/2023-24/123, dated 15/11/2023, outlines the guidelines and directives for implementation.
normalised: The move aims to enhance transparency and combat financial fraud by streamlining the identification process. Banks are also obligated to update their records with the latest Customer Identification File (C-I-F) number and ensure accurate information is reflected in the system. R-B-I circular number R-B-I/two thousand and twenty three-two thousand and twenty four/one hundred and twenty three, dated fifteenth November two thousand and twenty three, outlines the guidelines and directives for implementation.

unnormalised: This measure is expected to affect a significant number of account holders, particularly those who opened accounts before the introduction of mandatory PAN linking. The RBI urges customers to verify their KYC status and complete the necessary formalities to avoid any disruption to their banking operations. For further clarification, customers can refer to their bank's website or contact their customer service helpline. Some banks may also request form 60 if a PAN is not available.
